 Video and Music 
 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Video
                                 
 
 
 
 UCR has a large multimedia collection both on CD/DVD and streaming.  This page will get you started in finding some of our most useful resources. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Library Reserves Streaming Services (Course Instruction only)
                                 
 
 
 
 Although the campus is shutdown, library streaming services remain operational. 
 Instructors interested in streaming films or music for their course(s) in iLearn need to submit a course reserve request: 
 https://library.ucr.edu/instructional-support/put-materials-on-course-reserves 
 All requests will be reviewed and any titles that we are able to place online will remain active 24/7 until the last day of finals. However, due to the campus shutdown, some titles may be unavailable as staff will not have access to their video equipment. 
 If titles are unavailable, we will recommend alternatives. As always, please view the  library databases for other media streaming services 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Looking for Films...
                                 
 
 
 
 
 Henry Stewart Biomedical and Life Sciences Collection   Lectures with slides done by leading experts on biomedical and life sciences topics. 
 
 
 Kanopy Streaming Videos   Access or request streaming videos on a variety of subjects 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 JoVE
                                 
 
 
 
 JoVE , the Journal of Visualized Experiments, is an online "journal" with video protocols. At UCR, the Library has negotiated access for  the all of the JoVE Sections, including  JoVE Bioengineering ,  JoVE Biology ,  JoVE Immunology  and  JoVE Neuroscience 
 UCR has also begun subscribing to all of the Science Education Sections, such as  JoVE SE Chemistry  and  JoVE SE Advanced Biology

 How to Connect from off Campus
                                 
 
 
 
 Before you begin your research, connect to the Library. 
 
 Install the  GlobalProtect VPN 
 URL: campusvpn.ucr.edu  
 Sign in: NetID and Password 
 Verify: Using  Multi-factor Authentication (MFA)   
 Use: Open any browser and access library resources 
 Pin GlobalProtect somewhere easy to access
